text: Thunderhand's Maul

The axe formerly owned by the Legendary Keorl Thunderhand, it is carved from the heart of an ancient thunderbolt that struck the Norscan tundra. The Stormcaller Maul crackles with the power of the storm. Warriors who carry this axe are said to command the fury of lightning itself, their every strike accompanied by the deafening roar of thunder.
Ability: "Thunderhand's Maul''
Warriors who carry this axe are said to command the fury of lightning itself.
Thunderhand's Maul
Ironfang Reaver

Forged in the roaring fires of Norscan forges, the Ironfang Reaver is a testament to the skill of Norscan blacksmiths. Its razor-sharp edge is said to cleave through even the thickest armor with ease, making it a fearsome weapon in the hands of any warrior who dares to wield it. It was used in countless raids and bested not the merest of pallisades.
Ability: "Ironfang Reaver''
The razor-sharp edge is said to cleave through even the thickest armor with ease.
Ironfang Reaver
Bloodmoon Hatchet

Fashioned from the twisted roots of a cursed tree and quenched in the blood of werekin, the Bloodmoon Hatchet is a weapon of primal savagery. Its jagged blade drips with the blood of its victims, thirsting for the taste of flesh and bone. Legends say that those who wield the hatchet are granted the power of lycanthropy, becoming beasts of the night under the light of the blood moon. In any case, it is a weapon of immense might.
Ability: "Bloodmoon Hatchet''
The Bloodmoon Hatchet leaves a trail of freshBlood that werekin pick up for miles, even if it dit not kill a fresh victim.
Bloodmoon Hatchet
Wyrmfang Blades

Crafted by a legendary Norscan blacksmith using the bones of slain wyverns, the Wyrmfang Blades are renowned for their razor-sharp edges and unmatched agility. Wielders are said to move with the speed and ferocity of the beasts themselves, striking fear into the hearts of their enemies.
Ability: "Wyrmfang Blades''
Those who hold the Wyrmfang Blades are said to move with the speed and ferocity of the beasts themselves.
Wyrmfang Blades
The Seafoam Blade

Fashioned from the wreckage of a ship lost at sea, the Seafoam Blade is infused with the salty essence of the ocean. Legends speak of a lone survivor who forged the blade from salvaged materials, channeling the restless spirit of the sea into every swing.
Ability: "Seafoam Blade"
The Seafoam Blade is infused with the salty essence of the ocean and leaves unhealable wounds.
Seafoam Blade
Ravenwing Dualswords

Forged by a clan of skilled Norscan blacksmiths, the Ravenwing Dualswords are adorned with intricate carvings of ravens in flight. Legends say that the blades are blessed by the Raven God himself, granting their wielders the ability to command flocks of the dark birds to swarm and distract their enemies.
Ability: "Ravenwing Dualswords''
The Ravenwing Dualswords have colour changing laments depending on the position of the moon. They're swiftness matched only by their deadliness.
Ravenwing Dualswords
Shadowsteel Blade

Forged in the darkness of the Norscan forests, the Shadowsteel Blade is shrouded in mystery and intrigue. Crafted by skilled artisans using rare ores found deep underground, the sword is said to absorb the shadows around it, granting its wielder unparalleled stealth and agility in combat.
Ability: "Shadowsteel Blade''
Said to absorb the shadows around it, granting its wielder unparalleled stealth and agility in combat.
Shadowsteel Blade
Frostforged Crest

Crafted during the coldest winter in Norscan memory, the Frostforged Crest is adorned with icicles that never melt. Wearing this helm, warriors are said to be immune to the biting cold of the north, their spirits as unyielding as the ice from which the helm was formed.
Ability: "Frostforged Crest''
The wielder's spirit as unyielding as the ice from which the helm was formed.
Frostforged Crest
Ironclad Helm

Fashioned by Norscan smiths from the strongest iron mined deep within the mountains, the Ironclad Helm is renowned for its resilience and protective properties. Wearing this helm, warriors feel as steadfast as the mountains themselves, their resolve unyielding in the face of adversity.
Passive Ability: "Ironclad Helm''
Wearing this helm, warriors feel as steadfast as the mountains themselves.
Ironclad Helm
Runebound Aegis

Inscribed with ancient runes of protection by skilled Norscan runemasters, the Runebound Aegis is said to deflect even the deadliest of blows. Warriors who carry this shield are granted the blessings of their ancestors, their spirits shielded from harm by the power of the runes.
Ability: "Runebound Aegis''
Warriors who carry this shield are granted the blessings of their ancestors.
Runebound Aegis
Bloodbane Buckler

Fashioned from the scales of the great frost wyrms that roam the icy wastes of Norsca, the Bloodbane Buckler is as resilient as the creatures from which it was made. Warriors who bear this shield are said to be protected by the spirits of the wyrms, their scales turning aside all but the most determined attacks.
Passive Ability: "Bloodbane Buckler''
Warriors who bear this shield are said to be protected by the spirits of the wyrms.
Bloodbane Buckler
Fist of Skapa's Fjord

The Fist of Skapa's Fjord rose to fame during the Great Raid of Skaeling Bay, where it led a flotilla of longships in a devastating assault on the coastal settlements of the Empire. Its captain, a fearless warrior known as the Felman Ingersson, Chieftain of the Skaeling, carved a path of destruction across the southern shores, cementing its legacy as a symbol of Norscan supremacy upon the seas.
Rimefang's Legacy

Rimefang's Legacy is more than just a ship; it's a symbol of Norscan strength and resilience in the face of adversity. From the frozen fjords of Norsca to the snow-covered shores of Kislev, it has braved the harshest of northern winters and the deadliest of naval battles. Carved from the ancient pines of the Troll Country and insulated with layers of fur and ice, its hull is a fortress against the freezing seas, its crew unyielding in their quest for plunder and glory. With each voyage, Rimefang's Legacy adds to its storied history, leaving a trail of destruction and despair in its wake as it carves its name into the annals of Norscan legend.
Svunum's Stride

Not a mere longship: Svunum's Stride is a living embodiment of the Norscan lust for adventure and conquest. Its legendary voyage to Lustria is the stuff of sagas, as it braved the wrath of tropical tempests and battled ferocious sea monsters in the pursuit of riches and glory. Crafted from the timbers of ancient forests and adorned with the bones of slain sea serpents, its mast stands tall as a testament to its triumphs in the treacherous waters of the New World. From the frozen wastes of the north to the sun-drenched shores of Lustria, Stormcaller's Fury has sailed where few dare to tread, earning the fear and respect of all who cross its path.
Wavebreaker's Pride

Wavebreaker's Pride is not merely a longship; it's a testament to the indomitable spirit of Norscan craftsmanship and seafaring prowess. Hewn from the ancient oaks of the Darkwood Forest, its sturdy frame has weathered storms that would shatter lesser vessels. Reinforced with iron salvaged from the wreckage of Imperial galleons, its hull is a fortress against the crashing waves of the tumultuous seas. From the icy fjords of Norsca to the treacherous waters of the Sea of Claws, Wavebreaker's Pride has carved a path of destruction and glory, leaving a wake of shattered hulls and broken dreams in its relentless pursuit of plunder and conquest.
Orgrim the Wanderer

Orgrim is a Norscan berserker and hunter cast out of the Aeslings, for whom he now has nothing but contempt. His face is thin but sharp. He shows no signs of great age, being able to both hunt and slay a ymir on his own, carving the beast as a butcher would before it has been slain in combat. Over the years of his exile, he has grown a keen sense of smell that makes it all too easy for him to detect his hated kinsmen.
Eldagrimm's Beacon

In the rugged lands of the Bjornling tribes, amidst the towering peaks and crashing waves of the Sea of Claws, stands the mighty Eldagrimm Mountain. At its summit, shrouded in mist and myth, lies the Eldagrimm Beacon, a beacon of both hope and war.Forged in ancient times by the hands of Bjornling shamans and blessed by the spirits of the mountains, the Eldagrimm Beacon serves as a sacred symbol of unity and strength for the Bjornling people. It is said that the fires of the beacon burn with the essence of Eldagrimm itself, casting their light far across the sea and land. When lit, the Eldagrimm Beacon calls forth warriors from all corners of Bjornling territory, rallying them to the side of their High King in times of great need. Its flame serves as a guiding light for Bjornling longships navigating the treacherous waters, and its glow inspires courage and determination in the hearts of those who behold it.
Ability: "Eldagrimm's Beacon"
It is rumoured that when the beacons of Mount Eldagrimm are lit it is visible from the town of Salzenmund.
Eldagrimm's Beacon
Bransùil's Token

In the annals of Norsii history, the name of Bransùil the Aeslandeir echoes like a whispered curse across the ages. A master of the arcane arts and a wielder of unfathomable power, Bransùil was a figure of both fascination and dread in the time of Sigmar. Among his many artifacts of sorcery, none were as feared or as potent as the Token of Bransùil—a mysterious and enigmatic object that held sway over the very fabric of magic itself. Crafted from an otherworldly material and etched with ancient runes of power, the Token was a four-sided dice of prodigious size, its surfaces shimmering with arcane energy. When cast upon the ground, the Token of Bransùil unleashed a wave of mystical force that rippled through the ether, silencing the incantations of opposing mages and disrupting their spells with uncanny precision. The air crackled with raw magical energy as the Token exerted its will, rendering even the most skilled practitioners of the arcane powerless in its presence.
Ability: "Bransùil's Token"
A galder-smith, a warlock, a wyrd, a sorcerer, a seider - or just very lucky.
Bransùil's Token

Attribute: Wallbreaker for Marauder units
Keorl Thunderhand's Wargear

Jarl Keorl Thunderhand is a reknowned monster hunter, loving the challenge of fighting and killing the huge beasts and having no fear of them - often leaping onto their back and plunging his huge sword between their shoulders to pierce their heart. He met his demise against a Norscan Chieftain who took his gear as a prize.
Olaf Wolfhound's Weaponry

Olaf's brute of a man standing over seven feet tall with wild and frizzy red hair adding several more inches to his height. He has a broad, blustery face that shows his passions and rages plainly. He was slain by Egil Styrbjorn who took ultimate command over the Skaeling Tribe.
Kjell Red Fist's Gear

Kjell took his longship up the length of the River Qurveza in search of the Fount of Origins. As he progressed, Skinks crippled his ship but he continued on foot, his shaman guiding him towards his destination, but at a river crossing he was ambushed by Lizardmen. In the ford, he and the legendary Kroq-Gar fought, before Kjell was killed by the ancient Saurus Scar-Veteran's Carnosaur and his warriors wiped out.
Aygar Mistletaine's Gear

Aygar was born to Norscan adventurers in Lustria. He particpated in and led various raids up to the age of fifty before with several others, he broke into a ancient Slann tomb to the north of the powerful Amoco River and was the only survivor of a trap within, but he was unable to escape. His gear was claimed as a prize by a Skaeling Jarl who succesfully traversed his way to Skeggi to settle a bloodfeud.
Bransùil's Trinkets

Bransùil was a student of Kar Odacen who joined Sigmar in his quest. His magic concealed Sigmar and his comrades from a large Skaven warband. Although controversial amongst Norscans Vitki's, as some view his enchanted items as blasphemous, there is strong magical essence around them.

Ravensbite

The axe formerly owned by the Legendary Keorl Thunderhand, it is carved from the heart of an ancient thunderbolt that struck the Norscan tundra. The Stormcaller Maul crackles with the power of the storm. Warriors who carry this axe are said to command the fury of lightning itself, their every strike accompanied by the deafening roar of thunder.
Ability: "Ravensbite''
The blade hums with dark power, said to carry the souls of those it slays to the blood wolf himself.
Ravensbite
Howlcleaver

A wicked axe said to be quenched in the blood of a slain chieftain. It is whispered that those struck by it hear the distant cawing of hungry crows, their fate already sealed as carrion for the beasts of the battlefield.
Passive Ability: "Howlcleaver''
The legendary axe sings with each swing, its eerie wail striking fear into the hearts of lesser men.
Howlcleaver
Skullsplitter’s Visage
A helm forged from the skull of a great warlord, still bearing the scars of a thousand battles.
Ability: "Skullsplitter’s Visage''
A helm forged from the skull of a great warlord, still bearing the scars of a thousand battles.
Skullsplitter’s Visage
Havoc’s Embrace

Havoc’s Embrace – A cursed shield, taken from the ruins of a fallen Norse Dwarven temple, it whispers to its wielder, urging them to never falter - or they will face a death for worse than to be found on the battlefield.
Ability: "Havoc’s Embrace''
A cursed shield, taken from the ruins of a fallen Norse Dwarven temple, it whispers to its wielder, urging them to never falter.
Havoc’s Embrace
Yrsa Bloodsong

A skald-warrior whose songs of conquest stir the hearts of the next generation of raiders. She sings of old glories and future triumphs, her voice carrying over the din of battle, instilling courage in warriors who march to war under her verses.
Income from post-battle loot: %+n% when fighting at sea for each confederated Norscan tribe
Huld’s Lantern

Its figurehead holds aloft a strange lantern — a relic gifted by the sea-witch Huld. The flame never extinguishes, even beneath crashing waves or moonless storms. It wards off leviathans and sirens, but demands payment in gold — or blood. Sometimes, the light turns blue… and the ship disappears for days.
Thrym's Curse

Named for a slain sea-giant, whose bones were used in the ship’s keel and frame. When blood spills aboard, the mast creaks and booms with a voice not wholly mortal. Its crew claim to hear giant-song in the rigging — a dirge of vengeance and wrath. To fight aboard Thrym’s Curse is to fight under the eye of a very old hate.
Brine Reaper

No wind stirs its sail, no chant lifts its oars — yet the Brine Reaper glides onward. It moves only when blood is spilled upon its barnacled deck, soaking into the rotting wood. Those who step aboard feel the deck pulse beneath their feet, as if the ship were feeding. To sail it is to serve — to bleed, to offer, to drown in Mermedus’ favour.
Gildwake

Said to leave a trail of glittering coin upon the waves, Gildwake’s hull gleams with hammered gold filigree, its oars tipped in polished brass. Built in secret beneath the fjords of Varnhalv, every plank is bound with silver nails — minted, not forged. The ship is not merely a symbol of wealth, but a weapon of influence: port masters kneel as it approaches, and pirate fleets vanish mysteriously when it takes to sea. Eyri claims it can “smell gold on the tide,” and many swear it sails fastest when treasure is near.
Melee attack: %+n when laying siege or encircling

Halgrun the Half-Giant
The Bottomless Chest

Compass of the Drowned North
Lute of Galdur-Wail
Thorny Shrimp
Gravel-tongued Swordfish
Spotted Tuna
Bearded Sea Horse
Nearly invisible on seabeds, prized for its patience and meatiness.
Its teeth curve like scimitars, and it is said to fight until its last gill.
Flesh steams when exposed to air, and thuis it is never eaten raw.
Flashy and thick with fat, reserved for jarl feasts and storm offerings.
Almost invisible in water, yet deadly when touched - itis known to make sailors think they’re hallucinating.
Once a proud sky-hunter, now grounded — yet her wrath burns fiercer than her clipped wings ever soared.
Caught in reef crevices, this gluttonous creature is rumored to strangle crabs before devouring them whole.
Said to mumble curses in a drowned tongue when boiled down, which sailors often attempt hoping their scales would melt to pure gold.
Traded by pirates for squid ink tattoos, its flesh turns a brilliant red when cooked.
Only rises during overcast days, prized for its shadowy shimmer.
A delight for cats, sailors, and jesters.
Said to whistle when cooked over an open flame, a delicacy at blood feasts.
Feared by younger anglers due to its battle-worn hide, said to have survived a shark's maw.
Lives under graveyard wrecks, and glows faintly where curses were spoken.
Twice the size of a man, with tusks and bulk alike, he guards your command with chilling obedience.
No matter how often it is emptied, this damp chest always rattles with coin and salt-soaked spoils.
Packs tight in barrels and stinks to the heavens, but keeps raiders fed for weeks.
This rusted brass compass never points north — only to where blood was last spilled upon the sea.
Carved from driftwood and whale bone, its chords stir warriors to memory, grief, and the longing for home.
Often found clinging to coral roots, this crustacean snaps loudly before boiling into a delicacy.
Scrapes its snout across the ocean floor, leaving trails near sunken treasure.
This fast-swimming beast is a prize catch, often traded to Marienburgers for pickled lemons and dry wine
A fuzzy oddity revered by children and fools.
